numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young women tend to reach out to their parents more than young men.
2. Young women reach out to their parents the most in every part of the graph.
6. Young women use text messaging at a higher rate than young men.
7. Young women use telephone calls at a higher rate than young men.
8. In-person check-ins are equally popular among young men and young women.
9. Around 20% to 25% of young men use in-person check-ins.
10. Around 20% to 25% of young women use in-person check-ins.
11. I question why young men reach out to their parents at a significantly lower rate than young women.
12. I wonder whether texting is the most frequent mode because society is accustomed to texting.
13. Texting is significant to my community.
15. Texting is an essential component of everyday life in my community.
16. The graph is important for people of my age.
17. The graph depicts a communication pattern.
18. The graph emphasizes texting as the primary mode of communication in today's world.
19. Texting has become an essential part of daily life.
